bibl.title: Letter from Winifred Lyster to Howard A. Kelly, June 28, 1907

div1.p: Winifred Lyster sends a contribution for Kissinger.

div1.head: Letter from Winifred Lyster to Howard A. Kelly, June 28, 1907
div1.opener:
ans.
ack. ck.
Mr Howard A. Kelly;
My dear Sir!
div1.p:
I see in the current
number of the Outlook an
account of the present need
of a former soldier, John
R. Kissinger, who offered
himself as a subject for
the lamented Dr Reed's ex
-periments to determine the
mode of transmission of yellow fever-
I have often wondered what became
of those two young men - whose heroic
act certainly should long ago have
received some substantial reward-
I have mailed the cutting from the
Outlook to Hon. Edwin Denby, the
Congressman from this district, and
hope through him to interest others,-
I take pleasure in enclosing a check
for five dollars to be used for Kissinger's
benefit-
div1.closer:
Very Sincerely Yours Winifred Lee Brent Lyster.
(Mrs Henry F. Lyster) “The Pasadena”
Detroit. Michigan.28."June 1907.
